1.text: Dab soapy water if you spilled superglue on carpet.

2.text: Apply acetone to clothing items with superglue.

3.text: Mix baking soda with coconut oil to get superglue off of skin.

4.text: Scrub durable materials with fine sandpaper.

5.text: Rub a melamine sponge over less durable materials.

6.text: Remove sticker residue from cotton and other natural fiber clothes with acetone.

7.text: Take sticker residue off of synthetic fibers like spandex with the freezer and dish soap.

8.text: Use oil to remove adhesive from plastic.

9.text: Place glass bottles in warm, soapy water to remove labels and stickers.

10.text: Scrape glass, wood, and other surfaces with a plastic putty knife.

11.text: Use water and detergent to get school glue out of carpet.

12.text: Apply acetone to stubborn stains on most surfaces.

13.text: Use a blow dryer to release glue from wood.

14.text: Dab at epoxy with acetone before it sets.

15.text: Try methylated spirits on epoxy if acetone doesn't work.

16.text: Rub the area with sandpaper or a melamine sponge if the glue is already set.
